Sincerely,
Kevin McIntyre

June 11, 2019 at 3:39 PM ·

After learning about energy transfer in their PLTW - Project Lead The Way course, 4th-grade students from Milford, MA designed ways to quickly move food from a truck to a food pantry. Today, they teamed up with experts from The Greater Boston Food Bank and Vecna Robotics to refine their designs and see how The Greater Boston Food Bank operates to feed over 140,000 people in eastern MA each month.

Thank you to our host The Greater Boston Food Bank, to Vecna Robotics, and to event sponsor National Grid for making this experience possible for students!

#appliedlearning #PLTWMA #STEM #STEMeducation

College Financial Aid Presentation

We are hosting a College Financial Aid presentation on Wednesday, October 10 at 6:30pm in the high school auditorium. The seminar will be presented by the Massachusetts Educational Financing Authority (MEFA). We encourage you to visit their website at www.mefa.org for more information.

This is a great seminar for both students and families. If you have never been to a MEFA seminar, I strongly suggest attending. While the information is applicable for families with students at any grade-level, I believe it is most beneficial for families whose students are still in the earlier grades, as financial planning for college requires a multi-year strategy. Given that, if you have never attended a MEFA seminar and your student is in grade 11 or 12, I think this seminar is urgent for you to attend.

*** On behalf of the Town Clerk ***

EARLY VOTING FOR THE NOVEMBER 6TH STATE ELECTION WILL BEGIN ON OCTOBER 22ND AND RUN UNTIL NOVEMBER 2ND IN MILFORD.

EARLY VOTING IN PERSON WILL TAKE PLACE AT THE MILFORD TOWN CLERK’S OFFICE AT TOWN HALL (52 MAIN STREET) DURING THE FOLLOWING TIMES:

OCTOBER 22-26, 2018 FROM 8:30 AM UNTIL 5:00 PM
OCTOBER 27, 2018 FROM 9:00 AM UNTIL 12:00 PM
OCTOBER 29-NOV. 2, 2018 FROM 8:30 AM UNTIL 5:00 PM

IF YOU PREFER TO CAST YOUR BALLOT BY MAIL YOU MAY SUBMIT AND EARLY BALLOT APPLICATION TO THE MILFORD TOWN CLERK’S OFFICE.

IF YOU ARE GOING TO BE OUT OF TOWN ON ELECTION DAY, OR YOU HAVE A DISABILITY, OR YOU HAVE A RELIGIOUS BELIEF THAT PROHIBITS YOU FROM VOTING AT YOUR POLLING LOCATION ON ELECTION DAY YOU ARE ELIGIBLE TO VOTE BY ABSENTEE BALLOT.

THE DEADLINE TO APPLY FOR AN ABSENTEE BALLOT IS NOON ON NOVEMBER 5TH, BUT IF YOU NEED TO HAVE A BALLOT MAILED TO YOU PLEASE APPLY AS SOON AS POSSIBLE TO ENSURE SUFFICIENT TIME FOR DELIVERY.

FORMS AND INFORMATION REGARDING THE BALLOT QUESTIONS WILL BE AVAILABLE ON THE FOLLOWING WEBSITE: WWW.MASSEARLYVOTE.COM.

**** On behalf of the Town Clerk ****

TODAY, TUESDAY SEPTEMBER 25TH, IS NATIONAL VOTER REGISTRATION DAY. IF YOU ARE A UNITED STATES CITIZEN, 18 YEARS OF AGE OR OLDER AND WANT TO REGISTER TO VOTE PLEASE COME TO THE MILFORD TOWN HALL BETWEEN 8:30 AM- 5:00 PM.

VOTER REGISTRATION FORMS CAN BE FOUND ON THE TOWN OF MILFORD WEBSITE.

THE DEADLINE TO REGISTER TO VOTE FOR THE NOVEMBER 6TH ELECTION IS WEDNESDAY OCTOBER 17TH BY 8:00 PM AT THE MILFORD TOWN CLERK’S OFFICE.

ABSENTEE BALLOT APPLICATIONS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE TO ANY VOTERS WHO WILL BE UNABLE TO VOTE AT THEIR POLLING LOCATION ON NOVEMBER 6TH.

EARLY VOTING FOR THE NOVEMBER 6TH ELECTION BEGINS OCTOBER 22ND AND ENDS NOVEMBER 2ND.
